description: This course emphasizes skills necessary to understand and analyze data. Topics include
descriptive statistics, probability, and random variables, sampling theory, estimation, and
classical hypothesis testing, and practical and theoretical understanding of simple and multiple
regression analysis. Applications to economics and business problems use real data, realistic
applications, and Minitab for Windows. Written reports link statistical theory and practice with
communication of results. Prerequisite: Mathematics 120 or 121, and one of Economics
110-122, or consent of the instructor. Offered each semester.
